title: IShowSpeed Shocked to Learn Amish Woman Doesn't Know Who Cristiano Ronaldo Is
content:
Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience.

Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience.

Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience. Generate Key Takeaways

IShowSpeed was left shocked and seemingly appalled when he met an Amish person who wasn't familiar with Cristiano Ronaldo.

The popular streamer stopped in an Amish town as part of his Speed Does America tour and questioned a server about the outside world. After the woman admitted she didn’t know who he was, Speed seemed pleasantly surprised before revealing his identity.

“I’m actually a YouTuber,” he said with a smile. “It’s crazy that you don’t know who I am.”

After placing an order for a single scoop of strawberry ice cream in a waffle cone, Speed decided to ask if the woman knew who Ronaldo was. She denied knowing about the world-famous soccer player whom Speed seemingly loves more than life itself, prompting the streamer to look bewildered.

COMPLEX SHOP: Shop the brands you love, anytime and anywhere. Uncover what's next. Buy. Collect. Obsess.

Check out the clip of Speed’s wild reaction below.

Speed’s wholesome interactions with Amish people have been one of the highlights of his Speed Does America tour. In an adorable moment, Speed told a woman that he’s a professional soccer player in an accent that made her convulse with laughter.

In another clip, Speed wowed an Amish kid after showing him what a drone was, and the kid ran inside to grab his sunglasses.

The Speed Does America tour kicked off on Aug. 28. The trek, which will take him across 25 states in 35 days, began with a bang when he met Tom Brady. The two hung out at Brady's Indian Creek Island mansion in Miami, and the NFL star gave Speed a signed Ronaldo rookie card.

Though it was a legendary moment, Speed got frustrated when he discovered that his stream was lagging.

"Why the f**ksis it lagging while I’m meeting Tom Brady? Why is it lagging? Why is nobody saying shit?" Speed yelled to his production team.

"I’m talking to Tom Brady for 10 minutes about his Super Bowl trophies, and ain’t nobody saying shit,” he ranted. “Production! Production! Come on. This is the moment. What is going on?"

summary: Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article, which may not always match what's in the article but helps improve the user experience. The popular streamer, Speed, was shocked when he met an Amish woman who didn't know who Cristiano Ronaldo was. This was part of his Speed Does America tour, which began with a meeting with Tom Brady and gave Speed a signed Ronaldo rookie card. The tour also included an episode where Speed showed off his knowledge of Amish people and showed them what a drone was, and how he interacted with them.
shortSummary: Speed was shocked and appalled when he discovered an Amish woman didn’t know who Cristiano Ronaldo existed, while discussing his identity and lifestyle during his Speed Does America tour.

iShowSpeed Splurges on $100,000 Custom Cristiano Ronaldo Chain
The streamer is a super fan of Ronaldo and has a custom-made Lamborghini inspired by the football star.
iShowSpeed has taken his Cristiano Ronaldo fandom to the next level by purchasing a $100,000 custom-made chain with a pendant of the legendary footballer.
On Friday, the popular online streamer shared a video of him receiving the chain from the jeweler who made it for him. In the video, Speed can barely contain his excitement while telling his viewers that he had something very special made. Once the jeweler arrived, Speed took him outside and pulled out his Ronaldo-themed Lamborghini to make the chain reveal moment an event.
The jeweler then unwrapped the chain as Speed expressed delight with his purchase. The piece comes with a diamond encrusted chain and pendant of Ronaldo doing his iconic "Siuuu" celebration. Speed put the chain on and took several pictures while thanking the jeweler for his work on the piece.
Speed is a Ronaldo superfan. He often mimics his "Siuuu" celebration and wears the player's jersey. In 2023, Speed made it his mission to meet the Portuguese star in person, but missed his shot on several occasions.
He finally got the chance when he attended Portugal's Euro 2024 match against Bosnia and Herzegovina in Lisbon. After the game, Ronaldo exited his car and met with Speed, who was in shock seeing his idol in the flesh, and hugged him which brought a smile to the star's face.

MrBeast Says IShowSpeed Should ‘Act Normal’ Around Cristiano Ronaldo
"Don't cry, don't freak out, don't smell him, definitely don't bark at him," Beast said in a new interview.
MrBeast has some advice for IShowSpeed if he ever wants Cristiano Ronaldo to hang out with him.
In an interview with Dexerto’s Mike Kent for his Clickbaited podcast, the 26-year-old YouTuber acknowledged that Ronaldo, 40, broke his record for most YouTube subscribers gained in a month and discussed filming videos with the Portuguese soccer star.
Around the 51-minute mark in the video linked above, Beast said he initially expected Ronaldo to have minimal time for their shoot. He even joked about filming a quick, 3-minute segment on Ronaldo’s way to the bathroom.
To his surprise, Ronaldo was incredibly generous with his time and told Beast’s team they could take as long as they needed, and even invited him to hang out at his house afterward.
“We chatted off camera a lot and just hung out. It was just, like, not what I was expecting. I felt like he treated me way better than I ever imagined, very respectful, very giving of his time, and it was a really good experience, to be honest,” Beast recalled.
The conversation then shifted to IShowSpeed, 20, and his well-known obsession with Ronaldo.
“I mentioned Speed and he knew who Speed was, obviously. He's seen it and they met briefly for a couple of seconds at one time, I believe,” Beast said.
“But yeah, maybe Speed when you hang out with Ronaldo, maybe just act normal,” he advised. “It's a word of advice from someone who sat on his couch, spent hours with Ronaldo, like, just be chill. You just be yourself, Speed. Don't cry, don't freak out, don't smell him, definitely don't bark at him.”

IShowSpeed Scores Winning Penalty at Sidemen Charity Match
The score was 9-9 in the final minute before he did.
IShowSpeed scored the winning penalty which would crown the YouTube All-Stars as champions of the Sidemen Charity Match.
At the popular charity event that took place at Wembley Stadium, Speed’s YouTube Allstars team competed against KSI’s Sidemen FC. In a match where 18 goals were scored in 90 minutes, it was an action-packed competition that was tied 9-9 in the final minute.
Everything changed when Speed stepped up to kick in a penalty shot to win the game. After the score, Speed celebrated by doing one of his iconic backflips.
Check out a video of the moment below.
Speed’s epic win comes just days after he barked live on UCL Today during a national TV appearance. The streamer appeared as a guest on Paramount+’s UEFA Champions League show and made his case why Cristiano Ronaldo should be considered the GOAT.
Things took a hilarious turn when Micah Richards said to Speed, “Can I ask you about the barking?”
Speed then, of course, barked and startled Thierry Henry and Jamie Carragher. Afterwards, he explained why he barks. “That came from me when I was a young child,” he said. “Cause I grew up in Ohio.”
Afterwards, Speed raced Carragher live on air. No matter what trick he brought out, Carragher couldn’t beat Speed. To close out his appearance on the show, Speed did a backflip off the desk.

argos_summary: IShowSpeed, a popular streamer, was shocked when an Amish woman he met during his Speed Does America tour admitted she didn’t know who Cristiano Ronaldo was, highlighting a cultural gap between internet fame and rural communities. The incident was captured on video and added to Speed’s growing online persona. The tour, which began on Aug. 28, also featured a meeting with Tom Brady and other celebrity encounters.
